result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) .315%. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) .315% was dismissed by the court.

  • Thomas J. Meyer was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Thomas J. Meyer was found guilty of Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  No operation of m/v w/o valid DL.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol or drug paraphernalia.  Absolute Sobriety.  Random UAs. ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.

If extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Seek/maintain full time employment or schooling

Cover Letter from court of appeals - petition for leave to appeal is denied
Sentencing hearing on September 8, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Thomas J. Meyer in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Mike Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court of Appeals has denied petition for leave for appeal.  Court orders PSI and DE to go into custody by 11:00 AM today.  PSI to be submitted by 9/2/16.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Cover Letter from COA, petition for leave to appeal is denied
Cover Letter from DOJ AGA Michael Sanders
Copy of Motion for Enlargement of Time to File Response to Petition for Leave to Appeal
Cover Letter...from Atty Sanders to Ms. Fremgen
of filing of writ/petition
report to jail until PSI is completed, DE is granted leave to file a permissive appeal
Status conference on July 21, 2016 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Thomas J. Meyer in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea to Ct. 1 & 3 and dismiss but read in Cts. 2, 4.  State requesting PSI. Atty. Sarbacker does not agree to PSI.  No contest plea entered on Cts. 1 & 3, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Def. guilty.  Court orders PSI but hold off until appeal. Atty. Sarbacker renews motion for an interlocutory appeal.  Court sites under 808.03(2).  Court doesn't have authority but allowing appeal on that decision and clarity on legislation.  Court will grant permission for appeal.  Court has authority under 973.15(8)(a)1 not to be incarcerated during petition of interlocutory appeal. 

Counts 2 & 4: Dismissed but read in

Defendant Thomas J. Meyer in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  First take up Atty. Sarbacker's letter on PSI.  Atty. Albrecht responds, legislature procludes stay of sentence on OWIs.  Don't see a mechanism to get around it.  Court addresses Atty. Sarbacker on letter.  Atty. Sarbacker responds, DP not conviction.  Is it just adjudication or conviction for DOC to do PSI.  Court denies motion.  969.01(1) after conviction.  After conviction may order PSI  Statutes don't give a path to what Defendant is seeking, not satisfied to accept a plea today and deferred.  Atty. Sarbacker wants a chance to do an interlocutory appeal on Courts decision.  Recess for State to consider position on delay/witnesses.  State has a concern of witness' and length this case has been going on.  If Court thinks under 808.03(2) DE could plea and stay.  Need to proceed to plea before interlocutory appeal.  Under 978.35(8a)1 can this be done.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2016 at 08:45 am.
from Atty. Sarbacker

to modify bond

Motion hearing at 10-30-2015 09:00 am
Plea hearing at 01-06-2016 09:00 am.

Defendant Thomas J. Meyer in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Michael Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Court notes we are here on DE's motion to suppress filed back in May.  Parties agree there is nothing to add before the Court makes his ruling.  Court makes oral ruling.  Court rejects notion that the paramedic unlawfully performed the blood draw.  Motion to suppress is denied.  Atty Sarbacker requests FPT and JT be set to keep things moving.  State will be requesting a PSI so the DE would be remanded into custody immediately upon sentencing.  Requests JT and FPT be set after the holidays.  Court suggests plea/sent if they think the matter will be resolved rather than having a JT set.  Atty Sarbacker feels a plea hearing would be needed as the sentencing would be set out for PSI to be completed.  Bond continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 9 a.m.

Hearing at 10-14-2015 03:30 pm

Defendant Thomas J. Meyer in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court officer Jen Hudson appears.  Motion to suppress evidence.  Atty. Sarbacker withdrawing motions 1, 2 & 3.  Motion 4 - blood draw unreasonable.  Atty. Albrecht calls ranger Jennifer Hudson-Stanek, S&T, Mirror Lake Ranger.  Atty. Sarbacker cross exam witness.  Atty. Albrecht redirect.  Atty Sarbacker objects, overruled.  Atty. Albrecht calls Corey Quinn, sworn in, Baraboo paramedic.  Atty. Sarbacker objects to this witness.  Court states have to have some testimony  in order to rule on motion.  Atty. Albrecht makes argument on confidentiality of patient & doctor, probable cause already found.  Court overrule objection. Witness testifies.  Atty. Albrecht examine witness.  Atty. Sarbacker cross exam.  Atty. Albrecht redirect.  Release witness from subpoena.  Atty. Sarbacker would like to submit a brief to the Court within a week.  10 days for defense by 9/4/15; State by 9/21/15; Defense reply by 9/28/15. Court sets for status or ruling.  Hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Preliminary hearing on August 8, 2014 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Thomas J. Meyer appeared by video means with Steve Hughes and Attorney Steinman. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does not qualify.  State request $5,000 cash bond.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Agrees with cash bond.  Request lower cash bond.  Defendant is employed.  Preliminary hearing requested.  Time limits not waived.  $5,000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety at all times.  No oper. of MV w/out a valid DL.  Submit to chemical testing if requested by law enf.  Not to go on premises of Devil's Lake State Park.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2014 at 08:00 am.
